Killing Floor originally started out in 2005 as a free mod for Unreal Tournament 2004. Back then, it was a buggy mess. But after not hearing much about the game, Tripwire pulled the same thing they did with Red Orchestra by releasing it, 100% polished, as a standalone game. Killing Floor pins you and a group of people (unless you solo) against waves and waves of different types of zombies. From the starter Clots, to the obnoxious Siren and to the pants-defecating-inducing Fleshpound, Killing Floor keeps you on the edge while still creating a sense of joking around with the over the top British voices demanding for LOADSAMONEY and other goofy phrases. There is a story behind the game, but I don't even think Tripwire themselves even care about it anymore (none of the character packs involve special military operatives like the original 4 default characters). It's a fun indie title that I personally think gets you more enjoyment than Left 4 Dead does, although it plays much differently.
Fun to play with friends, more complicated than it looks

I've had the experience of playing KF for quite some time now...It has a lot of team elements that make it fun to play with friends as well as some RPGish elements in the sense that you can level up each class from LEVEL 1-6
To compare L4D to Killing floor would not be a good comparison...
Killing Floor is like tower defense, with each level you try to improve your characters weapon arson to destroy the zombie hordes. L4D does not have the RPG elements and is more about shooting down hordes of zombies while trying to make it to an objective.

Both are fun and both should be played.

This is the game with the most hours played out of any I own.

It's a great pick-up-and-play zombie shooter. The weapons and sounds and dismemberment are very satisfying, and the gameplay is tense and exciting. It contains a "leveling" system so the longer you play, the more powerful your character can get in various classes.

The game also contains that "second level" to gameplay. While the premise is easy -- shoot zombies -- but there are specific weapons and classes that are more effective against certain zombies and in certain situations. Learning all the ins and outs can make you very effective, but isn't always necessary.

Top that off with regular updates and events, non-invasive DLC, and a large playerbase, and you've got yourself a winner.
This game is awesome i like it better then Lfd2
amazing best team based for an fps game for a long long while

This is easily the most addicting team-based zombie game I've ever played.  It's a great mix of class-based tactical survival with a persistent leveling system and widely varying difficulty levels.  "Normal" difficulty will last most players forever, but then this game goes above and beyond with Hard, Suicidal, and Hell on Earth difficulties.  Each round usually takes about 30 minutes, and if your team survives it feels like a big accomplishment every time.

Several hour of fun, realistic weapon physic, nice and dark atmostphere.

The small Clots, Numerous Clowns, and Lovely Freaks of Nature are here as well. So, ready yourself, for slaughter is the main attraction in this show, and the audience always particepates in action.

So, come one, come all. To your deaths.

¿Tenés ganas de simplemente matar, matar, y matar? 
Entonces Killing Floor! 
Acción trepidante y adrenalina a montones sin mayor sentido que la violencia misma.

KF es un FPS cooperativo para 6 jugadores que deben resistir los embates de ola tras ola de hordas cada vez más grandes de monstruosos experimentos de laboratorio (o "zeds") que van desde "pequeñas" pero molestas "arañas" hasta gigantes con motosierras en vez de brazos. Y claro, el jefe del final, que puede acabar con todo el equipo él solito.

Para defenderte tendrás que comprar armas con el dinero que vayas ganando según la cantidad de zeds que mates, y según tu clase (hay muchas para elegir) podrás usar desde espadas, escopetas, rifles y ametralladoras, hasta lanzallamas, lanzagranadas, o lanzamisiles.

Y gracias a sus [b]bajos requerimientos de hardware[/b] es ideal para todos aquellos con PCs que se hayan quedado en el tiempo. Si ese es tu caso, no dejes de probarlo!
Buenisimo juego :D
Everyone who sees this recommendation likely already owns the game.  The few that don't....Russian spies, the lot of em.

I would honestly recommend anyone who loves horror  / survival to try this shooter out. This is by far the most fun (and possibly most disturbing) game I have yet to play. With easy-to-learn controls and 7 perks to level up, this game will not only rock your ass in Singleplayer mode, but will provide endless hours of non-stop fun in Multiplayer online or LAN. Buy it and I'll see you online.

Step 1: Kill zombies
Step 2: DOSH DOSH DOSH
Step 3: Kill bigger zombies

Experiments-gone-wrong run rampant in this new twist to the first-person zombie shooter!  Face enemies such as the basic clot and crawler to the fearsome scrake and fleshpound!  The game also allows the opportunity for the player to build their character, making it stronger as you accumulate damage with certain types of weapons and kills!  You can be a field medic, sharpshooter, support specialist, commando, firebug, berserker, or demolitions expert, all specializing in different types of weapons!  A great game to build comradery, Killing Floor focuses on the team and staving off massive hordes of specimens!

Одна из лучших кооперативных игр. Killing Floor очень классная, веселая местами очень сложная игра. Орды мутантов, не плохой выбор оружия, разнообразие перков выбирай да стреляй! И как здорово, что авторы не забывают про свое детище и постоянно делают новые карты (да и не стандартных выше крыши). Всем рекомендую!

A well made, team focused, zombie killing first-person shooter for up to 6 players per game unmodded. Contains very little story, but is good for hundreds to, for some, thousands of hours of gameplay with its multiple difficulties and perk levelling system (Do something enough times and you'll get bonuses to it). After a certain point, the difficulties change more than just health and damage, making certain difficulties much different than the last. Has a fairly large online community with practically no griefers, and receives free content updates every few months. All for just $20.
Great Fun Lads.

A very fun game more so than you'd ever expect. 6 player game very hard to solo. There are so many different kinds of zombies to fight and kill all unique and all having their little things to make them dangerous.  The game is just plain fun overall all around.
it's fun.

A classic as far as multiplayer co-op goes.  Once you start leveling up your perks and attempting Hard levels and above, the true co-op nature of this game really begins to shine.  There is a certain grind element that keeps most people playing, but it's the nature of the teamwork that must be accomplished that makes this game truly one to own.  The periodic content updates and events that Tripwire gives us also provide Killing Floor with enormous replay value.

Tripwire has a great vision as far as long-term support goes for their games.  Killing Floor shares a similar content update model to that of TF2.  If you like awesome games and hate boring games, free content updates, monsters and/or killing monsters then I think Killing Floor might just suit your fancy.  If you love the Left 4 Dead games and want a small change of pace, then you've met your match with Killing Floor.

No matter what you pay for Killing Floor, you're sure to get your money's worth out of it.

Love your friends?  Love killing stuff?  Love killing stuff with your friends?  Killing floor is the answer to that.  A varying selection of creatures to kill ranging from your simple clots all the way to the flesh pounder with a great selection of weapons to blast, shoot, brun, and maim those unlucky enough to get in your way.
